metadata.title: RHSA-2020:2443: OpenShift Container Platform 4.3.25 containernetworking-plugins security update (Moderate)
metadata.description:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform is Red Hat's cloud computing
Kubernetes application platform solution designed for on-premise or private
cloud deployments.

Security Fix(es):

* containernetworking/plugins: A vulnerability in IPv4 networking implementations allowed malicious containers in Kubernetes clusters to perform man-in-the-middle (MitM) attacks by redirecting traffic to the malicious container with “rogue” IPv6 router advertisements. (CVE-2020-10749)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

bugzilla.text: IPv6 router advertisements allow for MitM attacks on IPv4 clusters

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
containernetworking-plugins is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
